org.bsiet.combinations

Class LabelledText

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.bsiet.combinations.LabelledText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LabelledText
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    The Java Wizard Development team

    Use

    A component that gives you JLabel and JTextField next to it as a single component aligned in GroupLayout.
    You can even choose whether you want its alignment in HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL orientation.
    It supports all methods supported by both JLanel and JTextField.
    This component is returned in JPanel. So you either can initialize it as object or can store it in JPanel too.

    Sample Class


    import javax.swing.JPanel;
    import org.bsiet.combinations.LabelledText;
    import org.bsiet.layouts.MyLayout;

    public class LabelledTextSample extends JPanel {

    LabelledText lt1, lt2;

    public LabelledTextSample()
    {
    lt1 = new LabelledText("LabelText1", "DefaultText", 10);

    lt2 = new LabelledText("LabelText2", "Default", 10, true);

    MyLayout ml = new MyLayout(new Object[]{lt1, lt2}, true);
    add(ml);
    }
    }
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setSampleText

        public void setSampleText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the echo text for TextField.
        This actually sets the echo text for TextField which will get disappeared when TextField get's focus.
        It will again display the echo text if TextField is left blank and focus is lost.
        Parameters:
        text - the new sample text
        Since:
        1.7
